page.title: 01The Parish of Cockerham
page.content: The Parish of Cockerham is a pleasant rural area,composed of the main village street with a Butchers shop,General store & Post Office,Manor Inn & Bumbles restaurant.The Parish Hall,School & Police Station are also along the main street,mixed with houses old & new.Moving West from the village, St.Michaels Church,with its ancient Tower,is conspicuous on the high ground.Further along is another cluster of cottages & council houses. Farming is mainly dairying with some sheep,beef,arable & int.pig & hens.The caravan sites,canal & Parachute centre provide leisure activities.The River Cocker meanders across the area and under a new road bridge,part of the sea defence wall,which was built in 1971,when the river level was lowered to improve drainage.Fish are at times caught but pollution sometimes occurs.
